etymology.description: Pictogram: thatched cottage/house; originally the form of 舍, later phonetically borrowed to write 余 (“I; me”).
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a thatched hut and served as the graph for 舍 ‘house’. Because it sounded like the pronoun meaning ‘I; me’, the graph was borrowed for that word, and in modern usage (especially in Simplified) it also appears in ‘surplus’ senses via later phonetic borrowing.
etymology.simplification: Simplified from 餘 by dropping the food radical 飠/饣 and keeping the phonetic 余, a common simplification strategy that removes the semantic component.

examples.chinese: 账户余额还剩五十元(帳戶餘額還剩五十元)。
examples.pinyin: Zhànghù yú’é hái shèng wǔshí yuán.
examples.english: The account balance still has fifty yuan remaining.

examples.chinese: 我们把多余的食物分给邻居(我們把多餘的食物分給鄰居)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bǎ duōyú de shíwù fēn gěi línjū.
examples.english: We gave the surplus food to our neighbors.

examples.chinese: 余下的时间用来复习(餘下的時間用來複習)。
examples.pinyin: Yúxià de shíjiān yòng lái fùxí.
examples.english: Use the remaining time to review.
